com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.server

Interface RemoteObjectRegistration


  • public interface RemoteObjectRegistration
    Any Implementation of this Interface will handle the Registration of RemoteObjects at the Server-Side and therefore the delegation and Handling of RemoteAccessCommunicationRequests

    Internally it holds Objects, that are responsible to be called when ever an Object, created with RemoteObjectAccess is created. It contains methods to register and unregister Objects, identified by Classes. However, the provided classes have to be assignable from the provided Object.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • register

        @Experimental
void register(Object object)
        This call will register the given Object, identified by its class.

        Be careful with this call. If you want some class to be registered by its super-class or by any of its interfaces, use register(Object, Class[]) or hook(Object). In most cases

        Parameters:
        object - The object that should be registered

      • register

        @Experimental
void register(Object o,
                            Class<?>... identifier)
        This call will register the given Object, identified by ALL given Classes.

        This call does not check, whether or not the class of the Object is contained within the Array of Classes! Further, this by calling this Method it is not checked whether or not all public declared interfaces ar contained withing identifier

        To put it simple, the only thing that this method does, is to override any given instance with the declared classes

        However, any class within identifier must be assignable from the provided object

        Parameters:
        o - The Object
        identifier - the identifiers

      • hook

        @Experimental
void hook(Object object)
        Register the provided Object by all its class and all declared interfaces.

        This Method will register the object by its class as well as by all declared interfaces. So registering the following class:

        class Foo implements Serializable, Runnable { }

        by stating RemoteObjectRegistration#hook(new Foo()) will register the instance to Foo.class, Serializable.class and Runnable.class and will be called if one of those is requested to run.

        This WILL override any previously set registrations!

        Parameters:
        object - the Object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the Object is null
        See Also:
        register(Object), register(Object, Class[])

      • unregister

        @Experimental
void unregister(Object object)
        Unregisters an given Object, identified by its class.
        Parameters:
        object - the object that should be unregistered

      • unregister

        @Experimental
void unregister(Object object,
                              Class... identifiers)
        This call will unregisters the given Object, identified by ALL given Classes.

        This call does not check, whether or not the class of the Object is contained within the Array of Classes! Further, this by calling this Method it is not checked whether or not all public declared interfaces ar contained withing identifier

        To put it simple, the only thing that this method does, is to override any given instance with the declared classes

        However, any the Object registered to those identifiers has to be equal to the provided one. Therefor, if any other procedure overwrote the Object that where previously saved, this method will ignore this registration.

        Parameters:
        object - the Object, that should be registered internally
        identifiers - the identifiers to check for.

      • unregister

        @Experimental
void unregister(Class... identifier)
        This call unregisters any Objects, registered at any way internally.

        It makes no checks whether or not the provided objects are correct. If you want to only unregister certain objects, the use of unregister(Object, Class[]) is to be preferred. If you want to clear out, any instance of an Object, the use of unhook(Object) is to be preferred.

        Parameters:
        identifier - all identifiers, that should be unregistered.

      • unhook

        @Experimental
void unhook(Object object)
        Similarly to Hook, this will search for all public interfaces, declared by the direct class of the Object and unregister them
        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be unhooked
        See Also:
        hook(Object)

      • clear

        @Experimental
void clear()
        Clears out all saved instances.

        This means, also Classes annotated with RegistrationOverrideProhibited will be cleared!

      • run

        @Experimental
RemoteAccessCommunicationResponse run(RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest request)
        This call executes an RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest with the provided instances internally, then return a RemoteAccessCommunicationResponse.

        This method will search internally for the set instance, according to the RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest.clazz, which identifies the Object that should be called. If it finds an corresponding Class, it searches the Class via reflection for the provided RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest.methodName, which matches the RemoteAccessCommunicationRequest.parameters. if it can find any matching method, it will execute the first one and generate the Results of that Method.

        Any Exception thrown, will be cached and sent back to the Client. This means, the StackTrace will be the StackTrace which contains information about the Server! Use the IgnoreRemoteExceptions annotation to suppress this behaviour.

        If this Annotation is present, it will substitute the throwable with null and return null, even if an exception was thrown. In any case the Exception will be logged using the NetComLogging.

        If no Exception is encountered, the generated Result will be encapsulated within the RemoteAccessCommunicationResponse

        Parameters:
        request - the result, that was received over the Network
        Returns:
        the computed RemoteAccessCommunicationResponse, that should be send over the Network
